p.codeblock: virtual int createDataStream(int* streamId, const DataStreamConfig& config) = 0;
UFUNCTION(BlueprintCallable, Category = "Agora|IRtcEngine") int CreateDataStream(int& streamId, const FDataStreamConfig& config);
public abstract int CreateDataStream(ref int streamId, DataStreamConfig config);

p.props: android cpp apple unreal unity cs

section.p: Compared to , this method does not guarantee the reliability of data transmission. If a data packet is not received five seconds after it was sent, the SDK directly discards the data.
section.note: If you need a more comprehensive solution for low-latency, high-concurrency, and scalable real-time messaging and status synchronization, it is recommended to use .

section.title: Call timing
section.p: You can call this method either before or after joining a channel.

section.title: Restrictions
section.p: Each user can create up to five data streams during the lifecycle of . The data stream will be destroyed when leaving the channel, and the data stream needs to be recreated if needed.

The configurations for the data stream. See .

ul.li: 0: The data stream is successfully created.
ID of the created data stream, if the method call succeeds.
< 0: Failure. See for details and resolution suggestions.
